params.amount: is amount of otokens to exercise
params.options: is the address of the otoken

params._gammaController: is a top-level contract which allows users to perform multiple actions in the Gamma protocol https://github.com/opynfinance/GammaProtocol/blob/master/contracts/Controller.sol
params._oTokenFactory: is the Gamma protocol factory contract which spawns otokens https://github.com/opynfinance/GammaProtocol/blob/master/contracts/OtokenFactory.sol

params.depositAmount: is the amount deposited to open the vault.        This amount will determine how much otokens to mint.
params.optionTerms: is the terms of the option contract

params.amount: is the amount of tokens or options contract to exercise.        Only relevant for fungle protocols like Opyn
params.options: is the address of the options contract
params.recipient: is the account that receives the exercised profits.        This is needed since the adapter holds all the positions and the msg.sender is an instrument contract.

params.amount: is the amount of tokens or options contract to exercise        Only relevant for fungle protocols like Opyn
params.options: is the address of the options contract

params.optionTerms: is the terms of the option contract

params.zeroExOrder: is the 0x order struct constructed using the 0x API response passed by the frontend.

Exercised(address,address,uint256,uint25.notice: Emitted when an option contract is exercised

Purchased(address,string,address,uint256.notice: Emitted when a new option contract is purchased

canExercise(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Helper function that returns true if the option can be exercised now.

closeShort().notice: Close the existing short otoken position. Currently this implementation is simple. It closes the most recent vault opened by the contract. This assumes that the contract will only have a single vault open at any given time. Since calling `closeShort` deletes vaults, this assumption should hold.

constructor.notice: Constructor for the GammaAdapter which initializes a variables

createShort((address,address,address,uin.notice: Creates a short otoken position by opening a vault, depositing collateral and minting otokens. The sale of otokens is left to the caller contract to perform.

exerciseProfit(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Amount of profit made from exercising an option contract abs(current price - strike price)         0 if exercising out-the-money.

getOptionsAddress((address,address,addre.notice: Get the options contract's address based on the passed parameters

lookupOToken((address,address,address,ui.notice: Function to lookup oToken addresses. oToken addresses are keyed by an ABI-encoded byte string

nonFungible().notice: Boolean flag to indicate whether to use option IDs or not. Fungible protocols normally use tokens to represent option contracts.

optionsExist((address,address,address,ui.notice: Check if an options contract exist based on the passed parameters.

premium((address,address,address,uint256.notice: Gets the premium to buy `purchaseAmount` of the option contract in ETH terms.

protocolName().notice: Name of the adapter. E.g. "HEGIC", "OPYN_V1". Used as index key for adapter addresses

purchase((address,address,address,uint25.notice: Stubbed out for conforming to the IProtocolAdapter interface.

purchaseMethod().notice: Returns the purchase method used to purchase options

purchaseWithZeroEx((address,address,addr.notice: Purchases otokens using a 0x order struct It is the obligation of the delegate-calling contract to return the remaining msg.value back to the user.
